newsitem.title: JAPAN: Quake shakes southern Japan but no damage reported.
newsitem.headline: Quake shakes southern Japan but no damage reported.

text.p: A moderately strong earthquake measuring 6.2 on the Richter scale shook Japan's southern island of Kyushu on Wednesday, but there were no early reports of major damage or any casualties.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said in a statement the earthquake hit the island at 5.31 p.m. (0831 GMT) with the epicentre near the city of Kagoshima, 800 km (500 miles) southwest of Tokyo.

An agency spokesman said that although no reports of major damage had come in, trains were briefly stopped, Kagoshima Airport was shut and crews inspected roads to ensure there was no hidden structural damage.
Operations at Sendai nuclear power plant, about 40 km (25 miles) northeast of Kagoshima, were not disturbed by the tremor, Kyushu Electric Power Co. Inc. officials said.
A quake of such magnitude can cause severe damage.
